content:
I think I'll start by making a list of my tasks and categorizing them using the Eisenhower Matrix. Then, I'll schedule my tasks and activities in my calendar, making sure to prioritize my quality time with my parents. I'll also communicate my schedule with them so they know when I'm available. Additionally, I'll try to be more mindful of how I'm spending my time and make adjustments as needed. For example, if I find myself scrolling through social media during my free time, I'll remind myself that I could be spending that time with my parents instead.

I also want to make sure I'm not overcommitting myself, both at work and in my personal life. I'll learn to say no to tasks that are not essential or that I simply can't fit into my schedule. I'll also delegate tasks when possible, so I can free up more time for what's truly important to me.

Lastly, I'll review my priorities regularly to ensure I'm on track with my
